Description: Seven fragments of textile, cord and leather: 1. the leather (55x20mm) has traces of red ochre; 2. the cord is of dark brown/black hair (2 ply Z); 3. three textile fragments are dark brown wool, warp-1 ply S, dia. 1mm; weft-brown wool, 1 ply S, dia. 1mm; c.8x8tpc; 4. one textile fragment is of buff wool in a loose plain weave, warp-1 ply S, dia. 1 mm; weft-1 ply S, dia. 0.5mm; c.8x12tpc; some double picks; evidence of sewing with a dark brown yarn (1 ply S, dia. 1mm); 5. the other textile is a bundle of brown wool, loose plain weave; warp and weft-1 ply S crepe, dia. 1mm; tpc n/a; all edges ragged.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2, F1 fill outside SW wall
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Conservation: Photograph, document and prepare for storage and study as agreed by the British Museum and University of Glasgow: 01 Aug 2017
